results.title: All Writing Is a Process
results.brief_description: The recognition that all writing is a process is at the heart of contemporary teaching of writing. Covers such areas as: How do we help students to learn how to learn? How do we gauge progress? What role do computers have? What about grammar, spelling, punctuation? How can you conference everyone at once? Presented by Peta Heywood and Helen Bernes.

results.title: All The Same
results.brief_description: Asylum seeker Mostafa Azimitabar, know as ‘Moz’ shot and released the music video for his song ‘All The Same’ from inside the Manus Island detention centre via a mobile phone.

constellations_other.name: Seeking asylum
constellations_other.description: Chauka Please Tell Us the Time was covertly filmed on a smartphone inside the Manus Island Detention Centre and sent via WhatsApp.

results.title: All the love [B&W]
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Spastic Society of Victoria in the care and treatment of the cerebral palsied. Activities are designed to suit individual cases, always with the aim of fiting them for a normal life. Shows a variety of therapeutic treatments, and the organization of workshops within the Centres and under contract to outside companies.

results.title: All the king's men
results.creator_credit: Julian Jarrold, Gareth Neame, BBC-TV and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: An all-star cast portrays this most mysterious and poignant event of the First World War - the disappearance in action of the Sandringham Company at Gallipoli in 1915. Commanded by the Estate Manager, Captain Frank Beck (David Jason), they were just ordinary men - servants, grooms and gardeners - drawn from the staff of the King’s private residence. They left an idyllic rural existence for the fatally ill-prepared campaign and their deaths brought the horrors of the First World War to the heart of the establishment - and to the Royal Family itself. After the war a Special Envoy was sent at the behest of Queen Alexandra (Maggie Smith) to discover what fate had befallen the Company. But the truth was never fully revealed… Also includes a documentary “All the kings men”, produced in 1991 and presented by HRH The Prince Edward.

results.title: All that glitters
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner, Filmline International and Kinsman Media Corporation
results.brief_description: This film shows the origin, uses and economic value of gold, and the different ways in which gold and gold equities might be purchased, It traces the history of the lustruous precious metal, its romance and its economic importance.

results.title: All that Bach
results.creator_credit: Larry Weinstein, Louise Clark and Niv Fichman
results.brief_description: All that Bach is a delightful celebration of the music of J S Bach as it is played, danced, sung, jazzed, computed, tapped, electrified and busked by a wide range of internationally renowned artists. Among the performers highlighted in this spectacular homage are jazz pianist Keith Jarratt, Christopher Hogwood and the Academy of Ancient Music, contralto Maureen Forrester, cellist Anner Bylsma, the Canadian Bass and the National Tap Dance Company. “All that Bach” is an entertaining feast that revels in the richness of Bach’s musical legacy.

results.title: All set backstage
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox and Prahran College of Advanced Education
results.brief_description: The name of J.C. Williamson has long been associated with the theatre in Australia. In an early Paul Cox short film, he takes an historical look at J.C. Williamson and some of the famous acts they brought to Australia. Narrated by Lady Viola Tait.

results.title: All Of The Lights music video
All my own work
results.brief_description: An in-service education film for teachers. Aims to show how the new approaches in Art Education can be successfully applied to the classroom. The emphasis is on painting, while the new course is child-centered.
